sect1.title: Backticks
sect1.para: A double-quoted string delimited with grave accents (U＋0060) characters, or “backticks”, executes its contents as an operating system command and returns the output. This is achieved by the Kernel.` method, which can be redefined to alter these semantics. Alternative delimiters can be used with the corresponding %xdelimiter…delimiter construct, which follows the same rules as %Q.
